001package org.jfree.chart.plot;
002
003
004import org.jfree.data.Range;
005import java.awt.Graphics2D;
006import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
007import java.awt.Paint;
008import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
009import java.awt.geom.Arc2D;
010import java.io.Serializable;
011
012public class MeterPlotProduct2 implements Serializable, Cloneable {
013        private DialShape shape;
014        private int meterAngle;
015        private Range range;
016        private boolean drawBorder;
017
018        public DialShape getShape() {
019                return shape;
020        }
021
022        public void setShape(DialShape shape) {
023                this.shape = shape;
024        }
025
026        public int getMeterAngle() {
027                return meterAngle;
028        }
029
030        public void setMeterAngle2(int meterAngle) {
031                this.meterAngle = meterAngle;
032        }
033
034        public Range getRange() {
035                return range;
036        }
037
038        public void setRange2(Range range) {
039                this.range = range;
040        }
041
042        public boolean getDrawBorder() {
043                return drawBorder;
044        }
045
046        /**
047        * Fills an arc on the dial between the given values.
048        * @param g2   the graphics device.
049        * @param area   the plot area.
050        * @param minValue   the minimum data value.
051        * @param maxValue   the maximum data value.
052        * @param paint   the background paint ( {@code  null}  not permitted).
053        * @param dial   a flag that indicates whether the arc represents the whole dial.
054        */
055        public void fillArc(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, double minValue, double maxValue, Paint paint, boolean dial) {
056                Args.nullNotPermitted(paint, "paint");
057                double startAngle = valueToAngle(maxValue);
058                double endAngle = valueToAngle(minValue);
059                double extent = endAngle - startAngle;
060                double x = area.getX();
061                double y = area.getY();
062                double w = area.getWidth();
063                double h = area.getHeight();
064                int joinType = Arc2D.OPEN;
065                if (this.shape == DialShape.PIE) {
066                        joinType = Arc2D.PIE;
067                } else if (this.shape == DialShape.CHORD) {
068                        if (dial && this.meterAngle > 180) {
069                                joinType = Arc2D.CHORD;
070                        } else {
071                                joinType = Arc2D.PIE;
072                        }
073                } else if (this.shape == DialShape.CIRCLE) {
074                        joinType = Arc2D.PIE;
075                        if (dial) {
076                                extent = 360;
077                        }
078                } else {
079                        throw new IllegalStateException("DialShape not recognised.");
080                }
081                g2.setPaint(paint);
082                Arc2D.Double arc = new Arc2D.Double(x, y, w, h, startAngle, extent, joinType);
083                g2.fill(arc);
084        }
085
086        /**
087        * Sets the dial shape and sends a  {@link PlotChangeEvent}  to all registered listeners.
088        * @param shape   the shape ( {@code  null}  not permitted).
089        * @see #getDialShape()
090        */
091        public void setDialShape(DialShape shape, MeterPlot meterPlot) {
092                Args.nullNotPermitted(shape, "shape");
093                this.shape = shape;
094                meterPlot.fireChangeEvent();
095        }
096
097        /**
098        * Sets the angle (in degrees) for the whole range of the dial and sends a  {@link PlotChangeEvent}  to all registered listeners.
099        * @param angle   the angle (in degrees, in the range 1-360).
100        * @see #getMeterAngle()
101        */
102        public void setMeterAngle(int angle, MeterPlot meterPlot) {
103                if (angle < 1 || angle > 360) {
104                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid 'angle' (" + angle + ")");
105                }
106                this.meterAngle = angle;
107                meterPlot.fireChangeEvent();
108        }
109
110        /**
111        * Sets the range for the dial and sends a  {@link PlotChangeEvent}  to all registered listeners.
112        * @param range   the range ( {@code  null}  not permitted and zero-length ranges not permitted).
113        * @see #getRange()
114        */
115        public void setRange(Range range, MeterPlot meterPlot) {
116                Args.nullNotPermitted(range, "range");
117                if (!(range.getLength() > 0.0)) {
118                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Range length must be positive.");
119                }
120                this.range = range;
121                meterPlot.fireChangeEvent();
122        }
123
124        /**
125        * Translates a data value to an angle on the dial.
126        * @param value   the value.
127        * @return  The angle on the dial.
128        */
129        public double valueToAngle(double value) {
130                value = value - this.range.getLowerBound();
131                double baseAngle = 180 + ((this.meterAngle - 180) / 2.0);
132                return baseAngle - ((value / this.range.getLength()) * this.meterAngle);
133        }
134
135        /**
136        * Sets the flag that controls whether or not a rectangular border is drawn around the plot area and sends a  {@link PlotChangeEvent}  to all registered listeners.
137        * @param draw   the flag.
138        * @see #getDrawBorder()
139        */
140        public void setDrawBorder(boolean draw, MeterPlot meterPlot) {
141                this.drawBorder = draw;
142                meterPlot.fireChangeEvent();
143        }
144
145        public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
146                return (MeterPlotProduct2) super.clone();
147        }
148}
